translation: Guarding with {01} blocks attacks in all directions.{LF}However, guarding saps stamina, so be careful{LF}not to block too many attacks in succession or{LF}you'll run the risk of having your guard broken.{#Name="Guarding"}
source: Guarding with {01} blocks attacks in all directions.{LF}However, guarding saps stamina, so be careful{LF}not to block too many attacks in succession or{LF}you'll run the risk of having your guard broken.{#Name="Guarding"}

translation: To parry, press {01} just before an attack lands.{LF}If you parry an enemy's arrow, you can{LF}deflect the arrow back toward your foe.{#Name="Parrying"}
source: To parry, press {01} just before an attack lands.{LF}If you parry an enemy's arrow, you can{LF}deflect the arrow back toward your foe.{#Name="Parrying"}

translation: Use the mini-map on the top right of the{LF}screen to view your current position.{LF}You can press {01}{0A} to zoom in and out; if you{LF}get lost, try zooming out to view the full map.{#Name="The Mini-map"}
source: Use the mini-map on the top right of the{LF}screen to view your current position.{LF}You can press {01}{0A} to zoom in and out; if you{LF}get lost, try zooming out to view the full map.{#Name="The Mini-map"}

translation: Press {01}{0A} + {01}{0D} to activate Intoner Mode.{LF}Press it again at any time to exit this mode while{LF}keeping your Blood Gauge at its current level.{#Name="Intoner Mode"}
source: Press {01}{0A} + {01}{0D} to activate Intoner Mode.{LF}Press it again at any time to exit this mode while{LF}keeping your Blood Gauge at its current level.{#Name="Intoner Mode"}

translation: You can string together special combo attacks{LF}by pressing {01}{03} and {01}{04} in various sequences.{LF}View the Combo List in the Pause Menu to see all{LF}the possible combo routes for a particular weapon.{#Name="Combo Attacks"}
source: You can string together special combo attacks{LF}by pressing {01}{03} and {01}{04} in various sequences.{LF}View the Combo List in the Pause Menu to see all{LF}the possible combo routes for a particular weapon.{#Name="Combo Attacks"}

translation: Use {01}{01} while attacking with {01}{03} to launch both{LF}you and your foe into the air, allowing you to{LF}trigger midair strikes. Heavier foes cannot{LF}be juggled, so judge an enemy carefully{LF}before attempting this maneuver.{#Name="Aerial Combos"}
source: Use {01}{01} while attacking with {01}{03} to launch both{LF}you and your foe into the air, allowing you to{LF}trigger midair strikes. Heavier foes cannot{LF}be juggled, so judge an enemy carefully{LF}before attempting this maneuver.{#Name="Aerial Combos"}

translation: Press {01}{08} to lock on to a foe. Move {01}{0F} up, down,{LF}left, or right to switch between available targets.{#Name="Locking On"}
source: Press {01}{08} to lock on to a foe. Move {01}{0F} up, down,{LF}left, or right to switch between available targets.{#Name="Locking On"}

translation: Press the START button to open the Pause Menu.{LF}Press the up button to open the Combo List,{LF}or the down button to open the Items screen.{#Name="The Pause Menu"}
source: Press the START button to open the Pause Menu.{LF}Press the up button to open the Combo List,{LF}or the down button to open the Items screen.{#Name="The Pause Menu"}

translation: Press {01}{0B} to evade. Try locking on to a foe,{LF}then evading left or right to get behind{LF}them and gain the upper hand.{#Name="Evading"}
source: Press {01}{0B} to evade. Try locking on to a foe,{LF}then evading left or right to get behind{LF}them and gain the upper hand.{#Name="Evading"}

translation: You can also evade while jumping. This can be{LF}useful for dodging attacks while airborne, or for{LF}getting extra distance when jumping across gaps.{LF}Note that unlike when on the ground, you can't{LF}evade multiple times in succession when in the air.{#Name="Aerial Evading"}
source: You can also evade while jumping. This can be{LF}useful for dodging attacks while airborne, or for{LF}getting extra distance when jumping across gaps.{LF}Note that unlike when on the ground, you can't{LF}evade multiple times in succession when in the air.{#Name="Aerial Evading"}

translation: Press {01}{0D} to display an arrow indicator that{LF}points toward your next goal. Use this along with{LF}the mini-map if you ever find yourself lost.{#Name="Navigation Help"}
source: Press {01}{0D} to display an arrow indicator that{LF}points toward your next goal. Use this along with{LF}the mini-map if you ever find yourself lost.{#Name="Navigation Help"}

translation: Press {01}{09} or {01}{0C} to switch weapons.{LF}You can even do so in the middle of an attack,{LF}which will trigger an extra strike as you{LF}move from one weapon to the next.{#Name="Switching Weapons"}
source: Press {01}{09} or {01}{0C} to switch weapons.{LF}You can even do so in the middle of an attack,{LF}which will trigger an extra strike as you{LF}move from one weapon to the next.{#Name="Switching Weapons"}

translation: Your chain (hit) count will rise as you strike foes{LF}in rapid succession. Once it's high enough, you'll{LF}start to earn bonus bloodspheres and other drops.{#Name="Chain Combos"}
source: Your chain (hit) count will rise as you strike foes{LF}in rapid succession. Once it's high enough, you'll{LF}start to earn bonus bloodspheres and other drops.{#Name="Chain Combos"}

translation: Enter a summon circle and press {01} to call your{LF}dragon to fight alongside you. He will attack{LF}in various ways depending on the situation.{#Name="Summon Circles"}
source: Enter a summon circle and press {01} to call your{LF}dragon to fight alongside you. He will attack{LF}in various ways depending on the situation.{#Name="Summon Circles"}

translation: Visit the Database from the Main Menu{LF}to view Weapon Stories. Each time you{LF}upgrade a weapon and raise its level,{LF}you'll reveal more of its story.{#Name="Weapon Stories"}
source: Visit the Database from the Main Menu{LF}to view Weapon Stories. Each time you{LF}upgrade a weapon and raise its level,{LF}you'll reveal more of its story.{#Name="Weapon Stories"}

translation: You can upgrade weapons at the Battle Preparation{LF}menu. This requires both gold and base materials,{LF}which can be found in treasure chests and elsewhere.{LF}Base materials come in several varieties, and each{LF}weapon requires a specific one in order to upgrade.{#Name="Upgrading Weapons"}
source: You can upgrade weapons at the Battle Preparation{LF}menu. This requires both gold and base materials,{LF}which can be found in treasure chests and elsewhere.{LF}Base materials come in several varieties, and each{LF}weapon requires a specific one in order to upgrade.{#Name="Upgrading Weapons"}

translation: Though limited in range, swords allow for swift{LF}attacks, making them handy all-around weapons.{LF}They can be especially useful if you find{LF}yourself surrounded by a large force.{#Name="Swords"}
source: Though limited in range, swords allow for swift{LF}attacks, making them handy all-around weapons.{LF}They can be especially useful if you find{LF}yourself surrounded by a large force.{#Name="Swords"}

translation: The amount of damage you take within a{LF}mission decreases based on the number of{LF}continues used. If you fail, just keep trying!{#Name="Continues"}
source: The amount of damage you take within a{LF}mission decreases based on the number of{LF}continues used. If you fail, just keep trying!{#Name="Continues"}

translation: Accord will issue rewards as you complete her{LF}requests. Whenever you fulfill a request for the{LF}first time, she'll grant an additional bonus.{LF}Some bonuses (such as the ability to carry more{LF}recovery items) can only be earned in this way.{#Name="Accord's Requests"}
source: Accord will issue rewards as you complete her{LF}requests. Whenever you fulfill a request for the{LF}first time, she'll grant an additional bonus.{LF}Some bonuses (such as the ability to carry more{LF}recovery items) can only be earned in this way.{#Name="Accord's Requests"}

translation: Spears are heavy and slow, but offer the power{LF}and reach needed to break through enemy defenses.{LF}They can be useful when fighting tougher foes.{#Name="Spears"}
source: Spears are heavy and slow, but offer the power{LF}and reach needed to break through enemy defenses.{LF}They can be useful when fighting tougher foes.{#Name="Spears"}

translation: When fighting strong foes, tap {01}{03} rapidly to whittle{LF}away their health with bursts of deadly dragonfire.{LF}For groups of weaker enemies, hold down {01}{03}{LF}to lock on to and shoot multiple foes at once.{LF}Mix up your tactics as the situation demands.{#Name="Airborne Attacking"}
source: When fighting strong foes, tap {01}{03} rapidly to whittle{LF}away their health with bursts of deadly dragonfire.{LF}For groups of weaker enemies, hold down {01}{03}{LF}to lock on to and shoot multiple foes at once.{LF}Mix up your tactics as the situation demands.{#Name="Airborne Attacking"}

translation: Press {01}{0B} to perform a roll that makes you invincible{LF}for a brief period. If you lure enemies close and roll{LF}toward their attacks, you can fly right through them.{LF}Take advantage of this tactic when you don't have{LF}enough space to fully avoid an incoming strike.{#Name="Airborne Evading"}
source: Press {01}{0B} to perform a roll that makes you invincible{LF}for a brief period. If you lure enemies close and roll{LF}toward their attacks, you can fly right through them.{LF}Take advantage of this tactic when you don't have{LF}enough space to fully avoid an incoming strike.{#Name="Airborne Evading"}

translation: Combat bracers are good for stringing together{LF}combos. They also provide access to lots of{LF}powerful stamina-based moves. This mix of{LF}combo chaining and stamina strikes makes{LF}them most useful when battling single foes.{#Name="Combat Bracers"}
source: Combat bracers are good for stringing together{LF}combos. They also provide access to lots of{LF}powerful stamina-based moves. This mix of{LF}combo chaining and stamina strikes makes{LF}them most useful when battling single foes.{#Name="Combat Bracers"}

translation: Chakrams are great long-range weapons that{LF}allow you to strike from a distance while still{LF}holding your ground. Press and hold the attack{LF}button for a stronger charged strike.{#Name="Chakrams"}
source: Chakrams are great long-range weapons that{LF}allow you to strike from a distance while still{LF}holding your ground. Press and hold the attack{LF}button for a stronger charged strike.{#Name="Chakrams"}

translation: Magic-infused sunlight can sap your health.{LF}Find an area with some shade to cool down{LF}and recover from sun-based damage.{#Name="Sun Damage"}
source: Magic-infused sunlight can sap your health.{LF}Find an area with some shade to cool down{LF}and recover from sun-based damage.{#Name="Sun Damage"}

translation: An enormous city created by the Cataclysm.{LF}It enjoyed prosperity under the Church and its Magic{LF}Academy, but an accidental magic surge in 995 turned{LF}it into a ghost town. Also referred to as the "Old World"{LF}due to its ruins and status as the origin of all magic.{#Name="The Cathedral City"}
source: An enormous city created by the Cataclysm.{LF}It enjoyed prosperity under the Church and its Magic{LF}Academy, but an accidental magic surge in 995 turned{LF}it into a ghost town. Also referred to as the "Old World"{LF}due to its ruins and status as the origin of all magic.{#Name="The Cathedral City"}

translation: A nation under the rule of the Intoner, Five. It has{LF}little arable land, but bountiful marine resources.{LF}Renowned for its trawler ships, which exchange{LF}messages via a series of horns. Its port connects{LF}a multitude of sea routes, making it a trade hub.{#Name="The Land of Seas"}
source: A nation under the rule of the Intoner, Five. It has{LF}little arable land, but bountiful marine resources.{LF}Renowned for its trawler ships, which exchange{LF}messages via a series of horns. Its port connects{LF}a multitude of sea routes, making it a trade hub.{#Name="The Land of Seas"}

translation: A mountainous nation with fortresses at seemingly{LF}every turn. Its most famous product, Amberstone,{LF}is a rare material that can only be shipped by taking{LF}wagons along narrow and treacherous trails.{LF}Ruled by the Intoner, Four.{#Name="The Land of Mountains"}
source: A mountainous nation with fortresses at seemingly{LF}every turn. Its most famous product, Amberstone,{LF}is a rare material that can only be shipped by taking{LF}wagons along narrow and treacherous trails.{LF}Ruled by the Intoner, Four.{#Name="The Land of Mountains"}

translation: A nation mostly covered in forests. Much of it{LF}remains unexplored by mankind, and is instead{LF}the domain of faeries and elves. Ruled by the{LF}Intoner Three in theory, although she seems{LF}largely oblivious to what occurs there.{#Name="The Land of Forests"}
source: A nation mostly covered in forests. Much of it{LF}remains unexplored by mankind, and is instead{LF}the domain of faeries and elves. Ruled by the{LF}Intoner Three in theory, although she seems{LF}largely oblivious to what occurs there.{#Name="The Land of Forests"}

translation: A large nation mostly covered in desert,{LF}making it unsuitable for farming. Magnetite is{LF}its main export. While far from a wealthy land,{LF}its many ruins have seen tourism interest from{LF}wealthy merchants in recent years.{#Name="The Land of Sands"}
source: A large nation mostly covered in desert,{LF}making it unsuitable for farming. Magnetite is{LF}its main export. While far from a wealthy land,{LF}its many ruins have seen tourism interest from{LF}wealthy merchants in recent years.{#Name="The Land of Sands"}

translation: The Lands of Seas, Mountains, Forests, and Sands{LF}are each governed by an individual ruler.{LF}Past rulers were dictators that terrorized their {LF}people, but since the five Intoners defeated them,{LF}the world has returned to its peaceful days of yore.{#Name="Rulers"}
source: The Lands of Seas, Mountains, Forests, and Sands{LF}are each governed by an individual ruler.{LF}Past rulers were dictators that terrorized their {LF}people, but since the five Intoners defeated them,{LF}the world has returned to its peaceful days of yore.{#Name="Rulers"}

translation: A religious organization that has existed since{LF}antiquity. The group has grown rapidly since the{LF}Cataclysm, creating organizations like the Magic{LF}Academy to manage magic. Its multiple sects are{LF}known collectively as simply the "Church."{#Name="The Church"}
source: A religious organization that has existed since{LF}antiquity. The group has grown rapidly since the{LF}Cataclysm, creating organizations like the Magic{LF}Academy to manage magic. Its multiple sects are{LF}known collectively as simply the "Church."{#Name="The Church"}

translation: Generally, the younger woman of two siblings born{LF}from the same set of parents. A "sister-in-law" is the{LF}sister of a spouse or wife of a sibling, and does not{LF}necessarily possess a blood relation.{#Name="Younger Sister"}
source: Generally, the younger woman of two siblings born{LF}from the same set of parents. A "sister-in-law" is the{LF}sister of a spouse or wife of a sibling, and does not{LF}necessarily possess a blood relation.{#Name="Younger Sister"}

translation: Generally, the older woman of two siblings born{LF}from the same set of parents. A "sister-in-law" is the{LF}sister of a spouse or wife of a sibling, and does not{LF}necessarily possess a blood relation.{#Name="Elder Sister"}
source: Generally, the older woman of two siblings born{LF}from the same set of parents. A "sister-in-law" is the{LF}sister of a spouse or wife of a sibling, and does not{LF}necessarily possess a blood relation.{#Name="Elder Sister"}

translation: An organization built by the Church in 910 for the{LF}research of magic. Its early history is murky, but{LF}in 995, an accident triggered at the Cathedral City's{LF}Central Magic Academy wiped it off the map.{#Name="The Magic Academy"}
source: An organization built by the Church in 910 for the{LF}research of magic. Its early history is murky, but{LF}in 995, an accident triggered at the Cathedral City's{LF}Central Magic Academy wiped it off the map.{#Name="The Magic Academy"}

translation: A method of gathering and utilizing magical energy{LF}for a variety of uses, both combat-related and otherwise.{LF}In this era, there is no active study devoted to magic,{LF}and only a few limited applications have been{LF}passed down from earlier generations.{#Name="Magic"}
source: A method of gathering and utilizing magical energy{LF}for a variety of uses, both combat-related and otherwise.{LF}In this era, there is no active study devoted to magic,{LF}and only a few limited applications have been{LF}passed down from earlier generations.{#Name="Magic"}

translation: People who can use the power of song to wield vast{LF}attacking force. Six of them, all female, have been{LF}recorded throughout history. The Intoners freed each{LF}land from the despotic rulers that once terrorized{LF}their people, and are now worshipped as saviors.{#Name="Intoners"}
source: People who can use the power of song to wield vast{LF}attacking force. Six of them, all female, have been{LF}recorded throughout history. The Intoners freed each{LF}land from the despotic rulers that once terrorized{LF}their people, and are now worshipped as saviors.{#Name="Intoners"}

translation: Shops dealing in weapons and other items are{LF}located in each country. They chiefly run on an{LF}order-based system, and are largely unmanned{LF}as a result. Collectively, the stores are operated{LF}by a single person known as Accord.{#Name="Weapon Shops"}
source: Shops dealing in weapons and other items are{LF}located in each country. They chiefly run on an{LF}order-based system, and are largely unmanned{LF}as a result. Collectively, the stores are operated{LF}by a single person known as Accord.{#Name="Weapon Shops"}

translation: The strongest of all monsters. Possessing great{LF}intelligence, they live up in highlands and among{LF}the clouds, far away from human settlements.{LF}Ancient dragons and other subspecies also exist.{#Name="Dragons"}
source: The strongest of all monsters. Possessing great{LF}intelligence, they live up in highlands and among{LF}the clouds, far away from human settlements.{LF}Ancient dragons and other subspecies also exist.{#Name="Dragons"}

translation: Supernatural events beyond the ken of mankind.{LF}The Church calls them "salvation from the gods,"{LF}and many have been retold in folklore. Most people{LF}see the Intoners themselves as miracles, making them{LF}a common object of worship among the masses.{#Name="Miracles"}
source: Supernatural events beyond the ken of mankind.{LF}The Church calls them "salvation from the gods,"{LF}and many have been retold in folklore. Most people{LF}see the Intoners themselves as miracles, making them{LF}a common object of worship among the masses.{#Name="Miracles"}

translation: A disaster that occurred in 856, heralded by a vast{LF}earthquake in the Iberian Peninsula. This was{LF}followed by a huge city appearing overnight and{LF}unleashing strange creatures worldwide. Church{LF}records suggest this was a world-changing event.{#Name="The Cataclysm"}
source: A disaster that occurred in 856, heralded by a vast{LF}earthquake in the Iberian Peninsula. This was{LF}followed by a huge city appearing overnight and{LF}unleashing strange creatures worldwide. Church{LF}records suggest this was a world-changing event.{#Name="The Cataclysm"}

translation: The existence of parallel worlds triggered by{LF}entangled quantum matter has long been known.{LF}It is possible to shift, or branch, to multiple{LF}other worlds, although most such branches{LF}allow for travel in one direction only.{#Name="Multiple Worlds"}
source: The existence of parallel worlds triggered by{LF}entangled quantum matter has long been known.{LF}It is possible to shift, or branch, to multiple{LF}other worlds, although most such branches{LF}allow for travel in one direction only.{#Name="Multiple Worlds"}

translation: Persons, places, or things that can trigger a divergence,{LF}or branch, across multiple worlds. Branch phenomena{LF}occur when enough magic particles are in an area, and{LF}all relevant conditions are met. However, a singularity{LF}is not recorded as such until after a branch occurs.{#Name="Singularities"}
source: Persons, places, or things that can trigger a divergence,{LF}or branch, across multiple worlds. Branch phenomena{LF}occur when enough magic particles are in an area, and{LF}all relevant conditions are met. However, a singularity{LF}is not recorded as such until after a branch occurs.{#Name="Singularities"}

translation: The act of using the energy from one's flower{LF}for offensive or defensive purposes.{LF}It is fundamentally different from magic{LF}as it relies on harnessing energy from the{LF}mutual properties of multiple worlds.{#Name="The Power of Song"}
source: The act of using the energy from one's flower{LF}for offensive or defensive purposes.{LF}It is fundamentally different from magic{LF}as it relies on harnessing energy from the{LF}mutual properties of multiple worlds.{#Name="The Power of Song"}

translation: A parasitical plant-shaped object that latches{LF}on to an Intoner. As the parasite spreads,{LF}it erodes the host Intoner's spirit and body.{LF}It can be destroyed by using a weapon derived{LF}from the cellular material of a dragon.{#Name="The Flower"}
source: A parasitical plant-shaped object that latches{LF}on to an Intoner. As the parasite spreads,{LF}it erodes the host Intoner's spirit and body.{LF}It can be destroyed by using a weapon derived{LF}from the cellular material of a dragon.{#Name="The Flower"}
